body:
Ha, @candyleer I think your analysis is right. This is caused by dependencies of dependencies. Changing the boot sequence looks good for me. All existed boot services are only about timer or listener register.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/38530360-95c9a952-3c9c-11e8-868b-a406c3befc15.png)

For `log4j2`, I think it is another thing need to check. If none of our dependencies used it, it is good for now. 

Please follow your thoughts, and send a pull request to fix this. And I will ask @ascrutae to run the automatic test in SkyWalking infra, to recheck it in real applications.
@50168383 @wu-sheng this bug has been fixed in pr #1021

I think brave'TracingServerInterceptor can avoid "cross thread" situation.
https://github.com/openzipkin/brave/blob/master/instrumentation/grpc/src/main/java/brave/grpc/TracingServerInterceptor.java

I will read SkyWalking code deeply to find if it is a SkyWalking bug .
@candyleer Thanks a lot. I think I miss that :P
haha ,this is the same issue for spell error in #1021  which has been fixed right now in latest master branch

Sure, take your time. I tagged this question as `question`. And some design of our core has more restrictions than Zipkin ( FYI @adriancole ) , because manual instrumentation has more freedom, and you control more.

You can consider to optimize our instrumentation way.
:) Yes, you are right. Closing this.
@906827215 Could you give me more explicit details about conflict?  Is it log lib version conflict or something else?

@wu-sheng Hi, the reasons for more specific conflicts are not clear now. I only know that when I used it, it was because there were multiple log frameworks in my application that caused TID N/A in the log, but TID was correct when I removed the redundant log framework. But my application has to rely on the previous log framework, so there is a mistake. That's why we hope that we can have a good solution to this problem in the future. Above

@906827215 Oh, that is a very complex scenario, I have a guess, which is maybe our toolkit depends a log library, that has conflicts with your existed libs. This is only my suggestion.

Also, recommend you to review #1055 , which has similar situation. May be helpful. FYI @candyleer
It looks good for me. But first thing first, @ascrutae please run auto tests for this pr. This is a reflector for agent premain entrance, too important.

@xjr100419 this bug has been fixed in skywalking-ui module in [https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-ui/pull/156](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-ui/pull/156)
Fixed and closing this.
@peng-yongsheng Your CI fails.
@hanahmily You should pay attention about this. Once this pr merged, the collector settings keys changed, ex SSL-related keys.
I've got it

You can only use .zip on windows. The problem was solved when I use .zip on windows .
在windows上必须使用zip格式的包，否则就会出现这个问题。我一开始也是在windows上使用tar这种包，结果也是遇到这个问题，后来换成zip包，就好了。在linux上，可以使用tar包。
This PR is passed. Here is the [test report](https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/blob/master/2018/4/candyleer/testReport-master-2018-04-10-13-15.md)

Thanks. I see, and the document isn't right, it writes 'Elasticsearch 5.x'

> Thanks. I see, and the document isn't right, it writes 'Elasticsearch 5.x'

Yes. If you have time, please send a pull request to fix this document for helping others.

Ok, I will try my best. 
I also have another question with it. Why webapp process also quits when collector process quits?
@weenyaimac I don't know that. They are two separated processes in OS, just start up by one script. So I didn't think there is any connection between them.
@wu-sheng yes, I agree with your opinion because I also see the starting script. So I just wonder the reason.
Done
Done
Direct uplink translation maybe not correct.please check

@peng-yongsheng  travis-ci has failed cause of:
```
error: Server does not allow request for unadvertised object cad43d3d6a0bfa3cc5cb4e9a58f3ae2e3dee73c7
Fetched in submodule path 'skywalking-ui', but it did not contain cad43d3d6a0bfa3cc5cb4e9a58f3ae2e3dee73c7. Direct fetching of that commit failed.
```
dose it relate with this pr? this make me confused when i just update the documents only

Frontend has been fixed by https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-ui/pull/154

Closing. Thanks @candyleer

> dose it relate with this pr? this make me confused when i just update the documents only

You update submodule to another unexisted commitid. My guess, it is related to your fork repo. So please reverse it.
@wu-sheng yeah,i found it ,i will remove this dirty commit and commit again

@cyberdak Related pr #1063 proposed, please see. If we agree with all things we have discussed, please consider to 
1. Add `(Incubating)` in your document title
1. Solve conflict
1. Follow my previous comments, e.g. remove the setting in `application.yml`, even in comments.
1. Passed the CI

Then I will start to merge. @cyberdak You can test in your company env, and provide us more feedback about this feature.

Sure, the host setting of agent gRPC module must bind on IP/HOST which your agent side can be connected.

https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/03824c2f8f43d55746ac466f0252bd78c1b48363/apm-application-toolkit/apm-toolkit-trace/src/main/java/org/skywalking/apm/toolkit/trace/TraceContext.java#L37
这个TraceContext.traceId()方法有实现么？我搜了下代码，没看到耶~
@archer-christ `TraceContext.traceId()` is based on SkyWalking agent core too, this class is only a bridge. You can't use SkyWalking as a plugin for your logging system. This is not our target.

Server error`
How to solve it?

Coverage increased (+0.01%) to 19.777% when pulling **f00ba486fa84885a20b210f5ca384d24eec29681 on nikitap492:master** into **564239f1a2372c49306743524acbc41cf0271dbf on apache:master**.

There is no defference between these two methods. It is just a good practice to use already written methods, because it's more familiar for other developers.
Could you look at `InstanceCacheGuavaService`, for example. The methods `getApplicationId` , `getInstanceIdByAgentUUID` and `getInstanceIdByAddressId` had very similar code and few difference. I tried to generalize it. And did it for other classes with several caches

@nikitap492  Thanks. That is better to understand your pr. Then I will focus on codes only for this pr.

At least, we need to make sure there is no bug caused by this. Right? :) 

> Could you look at InstanceCacheGuavaService, for example. The methods getApplicationId , getInstanceIdByAgentUUID and getInstanceIdByAddressId had very similar code and few difference. I tried to generalize it.

For `InstanceCacheService`, you can try to refactor it. But don't try to merge these two method signatures. These two methods are about two different business scenario.

Right.
I understood that and didn't change any method signature

@nikitap492 For better and easier review and further merge, I recommend you close this pr, and open several separated pr for 
1. Object.isNull/NotNull refactor
1. GuavaCache refactor
1. Caffine refactor

etc.....

In this way, PPMCs can review and merge as quickly as possible.

1. I agree with your idea
2. we expect to create a span in parent thread when I run a main method ,
 and parent thread's globalTraceId will join the children thread LocalSpan
@peng-yongsheng I am wondering, whether this is a problem about too much data in single one query for ElasticSearch or Collector? `500` should mean a server-side error.

> we expect to create a span in parent thread when I run a main method ,
and parent thread's globalTraceId will join the children thread LocalSpan

But if there is no active span in parent thread, `createSpan`, `captureSnapshot` and propagate snapshot seem meaningless for me.
And please put `ContextManager.isActive()` into another pr. If I am right, `ContextManager` didn't have this method for now.

do you think a EntrySpan is better than LocalSpan in parent thread ? 
in main method , first time before calling child thread will generate a EntrySpan , and then create LocalSpan in later child thread

> do you think a EntrySpan is better than LocalSpan in parent thread ?
in main method , first time before calling child thread will generate a EntrySpan , and then create LocalSpan in later child thread

My point is any span looks like meaning less, if no active tracing context in parent thread. Because, that means, somehow, people don't care parent thread. Adding a span which only includes same operation name and tags can't help the end user. In that way, this is only a cost for tracing. 

This is my meaningless means.
Exception is `Read timed out`,  maybe the query performance is poor with 1 hour data of application function.
@peng-yongsheng Yes. 1 hours is most likely the largest duration (considering result points). Look like a performance issue.

@wu-sheng Hi, morning, yesterday I've solved this problem, through the ways which the collector.ribbon.listOfServers in the webappService.sh is set as foreign address instead of loopback 127.0.0.1. I think ui could not fetch the data from collector in my situation. Besides I don't try the last 1 hour , and I'll do the further observation.

meaningless but a little useful .
span created once in parent span, cost is limited . 
if we skip trace when there is no active context , some multi-thread application's trace will lost .

@weenyaimac Yes, I am aware that shell. Do you mean other people don't know that, they should change the shell when they deploy the webapp out of collector's machine? Maybe provide a `advanced` document for deploy?

> meaningless but a little useful .
span created once in parent span, cost is limited .
if we skip trace when there is no active context , some multi-thread application's trace will lost .

You would lose the multi-thread batch process, I guess which you refer. This span can't help you with grouping the several sub-thread processes.

thank for your suggestion, remove redundant LocalSpan in parent thread looks all right in skywalking-ui . http /case/cross-thread-->multi-thread-->http /jdk-cross-thread-scenario/case/echo --> springMVC /case/echo main method multi-thread calling redis

Closing this.

@weenyaimac And this document is already inside `quick-start/deploy-cluster/deploy-ui`, the link is https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/Deploy-backend-in-cluster-mode.md#deploy-ui-servers
Yes, sure
This PR has been tested. here is the new [test report](https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/blob/master/2018/4/carlvine500/testReport-master-2018-04-12-16-49.md)
@cyberdak Any update?
Right now, we have already supported collecting data from other agent/SDK. You can implement your own nginx SDK or plugin.
And there is no `opentracing moudle` concept. Please read OpenTracing specification.

@peng-yongsheng This PR still depends on your preview.
@wu-sheng I'm reviewing automated test now, it's too late. I will review this tomorrow morning.

@Anarchists I thinks this is a very serious conflict bug, caused by our dynamic instrument. I think your application is different than we expected, which is, you are serializing some Object, who's class is enhanced by us. 

But I can't find any clue in the stack. Do you use `@Trace` annotation? Or active Spring optional annotation?
@ascrutae I think you should pay attention on this, too.
Working on this. Provide extention to any language implementor.
I didn't use @Trace annotation
Then, could do provide the class source codes to us?
sorry, I can't
Sorry, I only mean classes are your session stores. This issue caused by that explicit class. I assume you are using some Spring session component.
FYI @liuhaoyang
